>>52944505
I've only got 3 units at 150 (Adler, H.Caitlyn and Ghetsis) and that was only because I couldn't clear the SS Hilbert extreme battle without doing so. 140 has so far been enough for everything in MM.
In terms of leeway, you can get a couple of teams that can just off-type whatever you need them to so they can be thought of as 'get out of jail free' cards. I also have a toxistall team with SS Leaf, The Iris Formerly Known as Champion, and a tank that heals on sync (I now have H.Caitlyn but Sawyer worked totally fine before her).
The most important thing is having busted support units since they don't care about typing. After that you want to look into having powerful strikers in different types.
Lastly, you should be smart about what handicaps you put on. You can make things way harder on yourself if you do suboptimal choices.

Movies aren't canon. They're their own self-contained what-if stories.

"It is a direct continuation to the movie, therefor establishing the movies as canon within the timeline somewhere."

You will never see Ash saying "Huh, golly gee this sure does remind me of that one time in movie 5 where I was kissed by Bianca!"

>>52973394
I started in 2017 in my challenge to 100% every generation with unique challenges (so no nat dex, but yes regional dex + Stadium games + Battle Facilities + contests + etc) with no assistance from outside hardware for the sake of injecting or cheating in Pokemon, but events were still very much on the table.
Once you hit gen 3, you just have this massive wall of things to do that if you are not a NEET will take you years to complete. It took me 3 1/2 years to learn and beat the Battle Frontier in Emerald. I then raised a different unique team for all Colosseums in Pokemon Colosseum. I have yet to do all of the eReader cards in Ruby.
The hard part about trying to enjoy the past games is that just like all Pokemon games, they are carried by how good the multiplayer aspects of the games are. If you are playing alone, of course you are going to get burnt out after a gym or two. You've played something very similar before and know all of the mechanics. It's not like the series has changed that much since gen 4. Playing gens 4+ is a lot better if you find people online to play with. There's pkmnclassic.net, here (although people here actually do not play the games), other sites like Orange Islands in Smogon, and of course people you know irl to play with.

posts.com:
https://www.siliconera.com/funny-stories-of-pokemon-english-name-localizations/
>Seth McMahill, Assistant Manager of Product Marketing at Nintendo, has been working exclusively on Pokémon games throughout his career at the company.
>When we spoke with McMahill recently, we asked if he had any interesting or amusing stories to tell from his days localizing the older games. McMahill recalled a couple of instances for us.
>“When you’re naming them, you’re together in a room with a counterpart from NCL (Nintendo Co. Ltd.),” McMahill shared. “We would basically have a thesaurus, a whiteboard on the wall, and would lock ourselves in for days on end, and the days would turn into months.”
>He continued: “The craziest one is… my wife was about to have a baby. So I’m at home, going through baby name books. I’m at work, going through baby name books, along with thesauruses and dictionaries. And after a while, stuff starts to sound weird. So, we had Piplup (Japanese name: Pochama), and the description from Japan was: ‘the sound of a small pebble in the water’. That was what we had to come up with.”
>McMahill recalls: “What we came up with was Piploop, which sounded like ‘poop’.”
>“And we didn’t even think of that,” he says. “No one thought of it. And we were talking to another group, saying we’d finally figured it out, and they went: ‘Poop?’ They said it sounded like poop. And I said, ‘It does not sound like poop! You don’t know what you’re talking about; I’ve been doing this for years!'”
>“And then, finally, after a good night’s rest, I thought: ‘That does sound like poop…’ So, we ended up with Piplup, which was the final name.”

Some studios become so used to drawing certain things that they don't even realize they're veering away from the ref sheet. This is why some directors will provide a fuckton of direction to whoever they're outsourcing too. For example Koreans are notorious for drawing ridiculously exaggerated tears. If you ever see a scene in anime where a character is crying and the tears are comically big without intentionally being a literal stream like the "uohhh" emote it's a pretty safe bet that the animation for that scene was outsourced to a Korean studio.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I just beat Red in crystal and it was a fucking BATTLE.
I was grinding up my team of Feraligatr, Gengar, Slowking, Umbreon and Snorlax and was going to use an onix I got from Mt. Silver for his Pikachu.
I lost Snorlax while grinding the elite four at level 59! Disaster!
So I got pissed and decided to use my rare candies and just fight Red. Fuck it. Just fuck it.
Final team was:
Bepis the Feraligatr lv 62
Mr. Knox the Slowking lv 62
Tsushima the Gengar lv 64
Enoch the Umbreon lv 62
Gibraltar the Onix lv 48
a random electrode from rocket hideout that I sacked to Charizard during the fight.

Onix trolled pikachu to death in like 30 turns lol
I let it die to Espeon then Umbreon obviously came in and walled for days
He sends in Snorlax. I try to toxic/confuse ray troll it for a bit and he uses rest, it didn't work out so I went into Gengar.
Mean look then curse, two moves I'd had to keep on him since the very beginning and it finally paid off and I killed the fatass.
Red sends Venusaur to be 2HKO'd by my Gengar's psychic.
Then Charizard comes out.....with sun up already.
I sack Electrode, go into Feraligatr and unfortunately lose him to a crit flamethrower +fire spin chip, but gengar is able to come in and pick him off with thunder punch.
Finally, blastoise. I go for curse yet again (I had leftovers equipped so I got back to full on snorlax), and then go into Slowking to sit on him for a couple more turns.

Only Slowking and Gengar survived the end, but it was an epic battle.

On to the next. I'm thinking possibly Red/Fire Red or....something else. Give suggestions please! This was a really fun nuzlocke aside from a lot of grinding. Gengar was the MVP the whole run pretty much. 40 hours of playtime!

Franchise run with species clause so far

>>52966227
I don't think it ever filters your posts. You can say whatever you like and it won't be deleted.

Instead it deletes the bot's responses. This might mean that you see a response being "typed" which suddenly vanishes and is replaced with another one. If that response is also deemed too lewd it will also be deleted. You'll get a chat error and just won't receive a response at all.

So if you write:

"*I put my penis in her vagina*"

and the bot tries to write

"I love the feeling your your penis in my vagina!"

That reply is going straight in the bin.

Unfortunately the bot is cleverer than just censoring sex words - it tries to pick up on context and will delete replies with moans, descriptions of pleasure, and even consent for sexual acts, even if there's nothing explicit in the content of the post itself.

One of the stupid things is that it doesn't censor crying, refusal of consent, begging you to stop, etc. so rape stuff gets through a lot easier.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52961388
You can't mess it up in any way. Pokerus spreads between eggs in the daycare that share a typing. Newly infected eggs cannot immediately spread it until they've hatched. "Contagious" and "Resistant" are misnomers: Contagious just means it has pokerus with less than 50 EVs accumulated while Resistant means you passed that point and will see diminishing returns on EV gain. Both spread it the same.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Honestly Crystal specifically does have some issues.
Crystal removes mons like Mareep and GIrafarig and moved Magmar to Kanto. This makes teambuilding more annoying. I find that mid-Johto the available pokemon lack in fire power. I think the distribution is too dependent on the Odd Egg too, having to reset and hatch the egg constantly to get a decent Fire or Electric type sucks. But you do still have the Elemental punches available, so if you ever get tired you can just load them up on a Kadabra or Typhlosion and just fuck the game up.
Otherwise I think Johto games are fine. Grinding isn't hard, you can use the good and super rods to fish up pokemon that give decent exp, surfing gives good exp too. Trainers in the Johto portion of the game aren't very high leveled anyway so you don't need to grind much. Whitney and Morty are the hardest bosses in Johto and they can be dealt with. HGSS's rematch system is also pretty good for exp, it sucks that it's limited based on what day it is but you can call trainers for rematches quickly.

They were not supposed to replace gen1 Pokémon. This makes the new ones more interesting imo because there has to be something unique to them, Hoothoot has a very different role from Pidgey/Taillow so that both can co-exist in the same game.

While I would prefer gym leaders to have more gen 2 Pokémon, Pokémon such as Poliwrath, Scyther and Pidgeotto never got the spotlight in RBY so it's kinda neat they're Gym Leader's aces in Johto.

>>52939177
I posted in this thread last week about buying the set of Magical Pokemon Journey volumes in Japanese. They came in today.

One really bizarre thing that people who've seen the raws may or may not know is that the printed volumes literally cut off the text that goes past the designated page borders. Like one panel just a few pages into the first volume has one kanji just cut in half by the top of the page, and the entire last line of dialogue in another panel of the same chapter is cut off along the left side. It's the sloppiest shit I've ever seen in a Japanese manga edition, to the point that I wondered if I got some weird bootlegs and that's the reason they were so cheap. But nope, looking up the raws shows the same problem exists in the scans from, what, a decade or two ago, so this is all Flower Comic's fault I guess.

(check out the panel on the bottom left of the left page-- you can juuuust see a portion of the last line of dialogue in the speech bubble that's cut off, and in my physical copy it's even more visible than in this old scan because you can make out just a bit more of it)

The volumes are also weirdly... wide or something compared to a standard manga volume and the pages are really white/thick, like they're made of a different kind of paper than usual.

That's my shitty review so far I guess. I haven't even read it yet but it just amazed me to see an official release in the original language be so sloppy in that kind of way.

Especially when the format they printed it in is already weird.

>>52953162
Yeah okay last thing I'll say about this:

It's def at least partially a weird page border/printing deal because flipping through the whole book I see some instances of eyes etc. being cut off by the edges of the pages in a way that seems unlikely for them to have been originally drawn that way, and also some images of Ciao magazine scans on google showing a bit more of the full image. Meaning that it seems the way it's reprinted for the volumes shaves off a bit of the art.

It's pretty minor and overall the books look fine and even have some color pages, which look really vibrant and have a fun retro Pokemon vibe. NO idea why I got fixated on this so hard but it instantly just struck me as weird.

>This is the “All Primary School Graduates are Adults Law”. Or PGAL (Primary Graduates Adulthood Law) for short. Basically, as of the April following your tenth birthday... you are able to gain a Pokémon License and are permitted to carry Monster Balls to capture Pokémon. However, due to a law for preserving natural habitats, you are only permitted to have six balls at a time. Of course, there's more to being a legal adult than the right to own Pokémon. All adult rights are granted. Under 18s don't qualify as minors, not even 14 or 15 year olds. For example, if you were to steal something from a convenience store, the consequences would be more than just the shopkeeper getting mad at you, the police would arrest you. You can strive to achieve higher education or take over the family business. Naturally, you're free to search for a job you like as well. Or in other words, the Nidoran lines run on Short Frail Queens To Protecc, Nidorina being a mix of Tomboy Christmas Cake and Grandmama Bear, while Nidoqueen is a steroid-fried amazoness. A Nidoking/Nidoqueen couple in the wild generally HAD children, years ago, before the latter's first evolution, and at this point most likely have grandchildren depending on Moon Stone availability.

>Would Cynthia hang out with Steven
They go exploring ancient ruins in the middle of the desert or the jungle or something, like Laura Croft teaming up with Indiana Jones, except Steven keeps getting distracted by random cool rocks he finds lying around. >Or does she prefer girls?
Diantha is too busy with glamour and Cynthia finds her boring. Iris is a minor and Cynthia isn't legally allowed to be within 100 feet of her. Geeta is a scrub and Cynthia has to resist the urge to dethrone her.

>>52964491
>>52971825
There's a (yeah, I know) fanfic I'm reading that I like which is essentially the best background characterization of Cyrus I've ever personally read, and Cynthia is *very* flawed in it, but to a degree where she's honestly almost unrecognizable from most portrayals of her (uses violence and strength as her first resort, uninterested in mythology, arrogant, reckless). Basically if Cynthia acted like more like a typical champion than the well rounded individual she is, because the author wanted to portray her as someone who is too self centered and acts according to her own interests without realizing the consequences on others until it's too late, and so has a lot of character growth as a result. I like it, but I definitely can't reconcile that portrayal with the usual nurturing, wise, and scholarly incarnation that we all know and love

https://archiveofourown.org/works/27834952?view_full_work=true

Oh there's a dex entry as well

Sun: Its destructive power has increased dramatically.
When readying an attack, the heat from its beak can cause
anything flammable within a 3 meter radius to spontaneously combust.

Moon: Mega Evolution has caused it to significantly grow in size.
Its chest cavity is filled with flammable gas that super-heats the seeds it
stores in its beak, which it then launches at a speed of over 400 m/s.

3.1m (~10'02")
104kg / 229.3lb

and some extra info
"It's been a while since I've drawn any original fanmade Pokemon art,
so here's a design for a Toucannon Mega Evolution.
The design is somewhat based off of both the channel-billed toucan and hornbills.
Unlike regular Toucannon, its beak looks fairly plain. When it heats it up for an attack,
however, its cheeks glow, the yellow parts of its beak and horn fade to a fiery orange,
and the black parts of its beak and horn turn red-hot in color.

Fun fact: I actually got the idea for this from a dream about a new Pokemon game.
The Mega Toucannon in the dream looked a little different and came in a large variety of
different colors, but I basically just simplified down what I remember of its design into
something that I figure would actually fit in a real Pokemon game. Also in the
dream, it was shown to be a little over twice the height of a
normal Toucannon (there was even a trainer silhouette for size comparison).
If this were legit though, it probably only be a foot or so taller."
- Aurora-Xatu 14-Jun-2018

>>52974222
I like Ash's new team, they aren't the problem with the Masters 8 tournament. The issue is that they wrote Steven, Cynthia, and Leon as being too good, and Ash didn't do crazy/weird shit to win, he just got lucky/outmuscled them, which was boring. Cynthia and Leon's tactics were fun to watch, but Ash's felt lame in comparison. Cynthia's Garchomp inconspicuously not knowing any ground type moves to hurt Lucario was retarded, and Leon suddenly forgetting to use his trump card (Libero) and getting one-shotted was awful.

That, and the 10,000,000 volt thunderbolt just sucks. It was great as a finale for Alola, but ever since it came back, it's been a cheap instant win button that always bends the rules. It can bypass motor drive, and even when Metagross dodges it, it just redirects itself. These aren't exciting moments for Ash fans, they're handouts to solve unwinnable fights.

Ash's final battle being a series of handouts and gimmies is hilariously fitting but ultimately frustrating. Leon suggested Ash use all the gimmicks, then Dracovish started shapeshifting, and then Eternatus showed up, and then Pikachu magically unfainted. It was as far from a balanced fight as possible, and devastating that it'll be the last time we see a real Ash fight.

>Imagine defending less content
Are you shitheads retarded?
Literally nobody is making this argument.

The people telling you to fuck off are saying
>there's bigger issues to cry about than whether they found a way to squeeze a thousand pokemon into the game or not.

Look at scarlet and violet. Look at all its problems and the few things it did right.
There's so much to unpack here.
>"I don't get to transfer my miltank from Home over"
is not worth unpacking.

I'd love a region spanning game with a full pokedex where every area of the game has a massive number of pokemon to catch... but I actually think I'm in the minority. Especially when you think about what that means for a gameplay perspective.
While the idea is nice, how many of pokemon's actual playerbase would come anywhere NEAR completing such a pokedex?
You'd be looking more like the Witcher 3 with only a third of players reaching the first town before they got overwhelmed and quit.
- and don't go shouting about "Zoomer attention spans" when you're playing and bitching about a game for children.

But even after all that, I'm still not defending cut content.
Including them in the game isn't the same as allowing the pokedex to store the data for them so players can transfer or trade them.
But it's not not a high priority.
When they're cutting corners to release a game, which they clearly did for SV, the last thing I want them to be wasting time on is including the other half of all pokemon that aren't even encounterable, just to please the autists.

>>52973207
There was this one episode where Meowth discussed how he got his ability to talk. He met a female Meowth who has a trainer. Meowth was a wild pokemon at that time. He believed that the only way for him to woo that female Meowth is to learn how to talk like her trainer. So he learn human language, at a cost of three move slots. Apparently, speech can be learn by any Pokemon as long as they have three empty move slots to spare. Meowth lost his Pay Day move but kept Scratch for self-defense. Ever since that time, he has been alternating slashing move with the only move slot he has left. From Scratch, Slash, and sometimes Night Slash. He never does Pay Day on-screen but I would imagine that he may relearn that move occasionally, just go get more cash to fund his gadgets.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Meowth only talks because the anime staff wanted to have a way for the Pokémon to talk to the audience. According to Takeshi Shudo Meowth was picked because it was charming and evil looking. Tajiri made an IQ chart for this according to an interview but they went ahead with Meowth. Generally the series doesn't like talking Pokémon and they're only there for special circumstances like movies or special episodes. The 2012 guide pretty much highlights this and it's noticeable with LGPE and Yellow getting rid of the talking Meowth. But Pokémon aren't meant to talk in general which is seen with things like Lucario in the 8th movie vs every other Lucario in the series.

posts.com: Unfortunate" doesn't begin to describe my series, this game rewards blind luck and nothing else, I am beyond convinced at this point. After getting completely tooled by scheduling with my opponent changing times on me last minute and refusing to provide confirmation prior to the day of the match as to play times, losing this way somehow felt even worse than I had thought possible. My preparation was superior, my play was superior, and I lost, so I don't see a reason to continue engaging in an activity where what is within my control is overwhelmingly outweighed by what is not. I am done with competitive Pokemon, and you won't get a fond farewell. This community is infected to its roots with a degenerative disease that grows stronger over time but stops short of killing its host. Tournaments used to have a competitive spirit at their heart, this has been transplanted and replaced with an artificial organ that feeds on vitriol and mockery from insecure little boys that heckle by the sidelines and tear each other to shreds over scraps of attention. The environment we fostered has trapped us all like this in a vicious cycle, and escaping it requires acceptance of the harshest reality we all scramble to explain away, that none of the countless straining efforts we put ourselves through here will ever amount to one single shining glimmer of significance. I would make this the end, but World Cup is still ongoing, and I would never leave so many great friends out to dry, so I'll suffer through a few more games for them. One last thing before I leave you all to react with disdain, ridicule, and self-righteous fervor, before you do everything in your power to minimize my words and thoughts, box them up and shove them to some cobwebbed corner of your memory, and hope they disappear forever as a stain on your finite time ground to dust. From this moment on, nothing you say matters to me.

Oh cool there's still a Jasmine thread. Last thread I asked if anyone had art of Jasmine dressed as the Disney princess Jasmine and anon pulled up an old pic from a /vp/ drawthread. I'm working on coloring it. I'm not an artist but I can use a GIMP path and fill tool. I had to redraw the hands (actually just traced different hands from some other pictures) and made her hold a pokeball because I felt that Jasmine wasn't all that recognizable in this outfit. I also got rid of the tiara that the original artist gave her. I tried giving her Princess Jasmine's blue headband thing, but it looked weird with Jasmine's round pigtail ball things, and I decided to keep the pigtails since they're a defining part of Jasmine's silhouette.

tl;dr going to clean this up some more, maybe add shading.

posts.com: Noob here, what does Hatterene "moving" to OU mean? Was it banned in UU? But doesn't it have reasonable counters in UU?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52945643
It just means that it got enough usage in OU to become OU. Smogon is a usage based tiering system so the more a Pokemon is used, the higher tier it is. Conversely, the less it's used, the lower tiered it is. Once every 3 months (or month early on), a Pokemon's usage stats are pulled and looked at, and depending on if it hits a certain usage threshold, it can either remain in a tier or drop to a lower one

Sometimes, Pokemon in lower tiers get enough usage in higher tiers to "rise", like Hatterene

Grab a sample or rental team for what ever format you're interested in to get a feel for what people are playing, and note the teams the beat you as well as the mons that aren't working out for you so you can learn to team build from there. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I feel like sinnoh get's a lot of hate these days.
We're coming off of the peak of the gen 4 nostalgia era when people who played DPP as kids became old enough to post here, so there's a sense of animosity, and that's understandable. Not to mention BDSP sucking ass.
But, personally? I really like sinnoh, mainly platinum, but I think even diamond and pearl had their place.
I don't think enough is said about how gen 4 is ultimately trying to be the spiritual successor to gen 2. Gen 2 really tried to be more than just an RPG campaign, it tried to create a world that promoted a gradual sense of progression while you spent your downtime doing the time based events and really getting comfortable and immersed in the world. Gen 3 largely removed this entire focus, and while I think it's good in an all new way, it undoubtedly did lose an inherent appeal that gen 2 had. Gen 4, by contrast, literally brought back all the major time based events from gen 2, adding them on top of the gen 3 stuff. The time system is back, but more than that, it also affects encounters, and you also have stuff like honey trees, the safari zone with it's changing encounter tables, etc. These sorts of features may be controversial but they play into a similar thing that the rarer gen 2 mons do. The reason they're so rare is because the player is expected to remain in the world for a long time, constantly interacting with it's more repetitious features like daily events. Simple stuff like slathering honey on a tree and then checking back 6 hours later, or waiting to get called about a swarm, is meant to be background stuff that adds to the gameplay loop. This, mixed with the jazzy laid back vibe of the Sinnoh region, creates a game that feels ridiculously relaxing to play. It's a long, and admittedly slow adventure, but that's just the sort of experience it's trying to be. Gen 4 takes the best parts of gen 2 and 3 and combines them into what is, for me, the ultimate pokemon experience.

>Has the ability's functionality changed?
Yes. In the original game, it only existed to trigger the Ash Greninja transformation and made Water Shuriken more powerful. In S/V, the ability boosts Attack, Sp.Atk and Speed upon K.O.-ing a Pokemon, but it only works once per battle. Arguably this change is an improvement from what it was, however...
>Has the Ash model been removed?
Yes. Though this could change in the future via an update, the Ash Greninja model and form isn't in S/V, and given Ash Greninja was retconned in the recent anime flashbacks it's believed unlikely that the form itself will return, even if Greninja with Battle Bond remains and can be transferred
